  3. 10 Best High-Waisted Compression Leggings For Women, Per Doctors And Reviewers

# 10 Best High-Waisted Compression Leggings For Women, Per Doctors And
Reviewers

They fit just right without being painfully tight.

By Sabrina Talbert

Updated: Mar 22, 2023

Save Article

Women's Health may earn commission from the links on this page, but we only
feature products we believe in. Why Trust Us?

When I discovered compression socks, they leveled up my travel. It's true,
those two little pieces of stretchy fabric were game-changers. As soon as I
touched down in a new destination, my legs felt ready for exploring instead of
sluggish and swollen.

Naturally, I wondered what compression leggings could do. What if they could
_actually_ help you have a better workout? Turns out, they can. Compression
leggings helped improve muscle recovery, especially after intense sweats,
according to a 2019 study.

Here's how: Compression leggings are designed to increase blood flow to the
muscles in the lower half of your body during exercise, bringing more oxygen
to them, explains sports medicine specialist and orthopedic surgeon Dr.
Natasha Trentacosta, MD. That's why it's no surprise that a lot of athletes
swear that wiggling into a pair is a game-changer.

Shop the best compression legging deals on Amazon

 _Peep a few of the best reviewer-loved compression leggings, below:_

“Some people actually feel their strength and power improve while exercising
in compression tights, particularly during explosive movements, like
plyometrics and heavy lifting,” says sports medicine specialist and orthopedic
surgeon David Geier, MD.

But, there are tons of benefits beyond the gym, too. Physician Laura Purdy,
MD, notes that compression leggings tend to be especially helpful to those who
work jobs that require them to stand for several hours. Think retail workers,
surgeons, teachers, etc. She says that women who are pregnant and people with
diabetes, varicose veins, heart failure, lymphedema, or psoriasis can also
benefit from the increased circulation they offer.

See below for the nine best, most popular compression leggings, according to
rave reviews.

1

Best Compression Leggings For Running

## Lululemon SenseKnit High-Rise Running Tight

1

Best Compression Leggings For Running

## Lululemon SenseKnit High-Rise Running Tight

$168 at Lululemon

Credit: Lululemon

Pump up the energy on long runs with these supportive leggings. The feeling is
free and unrestricted running freedom thanks to targeted support and
breathable four-way stretch fabric.

 **Rave Review:** "Tighter than expected (but they are meant to be tight).
Once they are on you feel so snatched but also able to move. Highly
recommend!"

Average Rating| 4/5  
---|---  
Number of Reviews| 90  
  
2

Best Compression Leggings For Cross Training

## 2XU Mid-Rise Compression Tights

2

Best Compression Leggings For Cross Training

## 2XU Mid-Rise Compression Tights

Now 30% Off

$70 at Amazon

Australian activewear brand 2XU offers tights for pretty much every activity.
This mid-rise style squeezes all the right places in a breathable, lightweight
fabric ideal for a range of low and high-impact training.

**Rave Review:** “Bought these for my first Spartan race and glad that I did!
Saved my legs through all of the obstacles and cleaned up well after the roll
in the mud, climb over the walls, and crawl under barbed wire. I will get much
use out of these tights in my runs and in my training.”

Average Rating| 3.8/5  
---|---  
Number Of Reviews| 114  
  
3

Best Compression Leggings For Travel

## CW-X Stabilyx Joint Support Compression Tight

3

Best Compression Leggings For Travel

## CW-X Stabilyx Joint Support Compression Tight

Now 21% Off

$87 at Amazon$120 at Zappos

CW-X's patented tech was designed to mimic kinesiology tape that trainers use
to help stimulate blood flow in muscles and joints. This specific pair of
tights does that with targeted support over key muscle groups, like the thighs
and buttocks. People love wearing them on long flights.

 ** **Rave Review** : **"Bought these as compression leggings for a very long
flight. They were so comfortable! Medical grade compression. Very flattering
fit. Love these for working out also. I would buy them again!"

Average Rating| 4.5/5  
---|---  
Number Of Reviews| 964

4

Most Comfortable Compression Leggings

## Spanx Look At Me Now Seamless Leggings

4

Most Comfortable Compression Leggings

## Spanx Look At Me Now Seamless Leggings

Now 12% Off

$60 at Amazon$67 at Zappos

Score Spanx's signature lifting and shaping technology alongside its
performance fabric, offering four-way stretch and antimicrobial properties.
Unlike a lot of restrictive and suffocating compression leggings, these are
seamless and were specifically designed to provide maximum comfort. Plus, they
come in 13 versatile color options.

 ** **Rave Review** :** “Absolutely in love with these leggings. Perfect fit.
They provide excellent support and firmness on the abdominal area in addition
to comfort and style. Highly recommended."

Average Rating|  4.1/5  
---|---  
Number Of Reviews| 2,708  
  
5

Best Thick Waistband

## Adidas Originals Classics Tonal 3-Stripes Leggings

5

Best Thick Waistband

## Adidas Originals Classics Tonal 3-Stripes Leggings

Now 31% Off

$34 at Amazon

Credit: Adidas

In addition to a compression fabric that keeps your blood flowing, these
tights are designed to feel like a second layer of skin. The thick elastic
waistband also allows you to move comfortably while maintaining a tight fit.

****Rave Review** : **“Wore this to the gym on leg day, and it’s a tight fit.
They stay in place and have a thick feel but breathable material. Quality
leggings that keeps you dry. Will buy again."

Average Rating| 4.4/5  
---|---  
Number Of Reviews| 309  
  
6

Best For High Intensity Workouts

## CRZ YOGA Hugged Feeling Compression Leggings

6

Best For High Intensity Workouts

## CRZ YOGA Hugged Feeling Compression Leggings

$20 at Amazon

These leggings offer high support and are ultra durable, all while being
moisture-wicking. The four-way stretch allows for comfortable movement, but
the tight fit also reduces muscle vibration. All that makes these a great
option for your sweatiest high intensity workouts.

 ** **Rave Review** : **“Love them!! They are super soft, and thick but not
hot. Good for squats, running, and relaxing. Very flattering, and hugs in the
right places without restrictions to movement."

Average Rating| 4.3/5  
---|---  
Number Of Reviews| 1991  
  
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

7

Most Breathable Compression Leggings

## Homma High-Waisted Compression Leggings

7

Most Breathable Compression Leggings

## Homma High-Waisted Compression Leggings

Now 37% Off

$22 at Amazon

Designed with the brand's signature control fabric, these offer high
compression without feeling like they'll suffocate you, so they're a great
warm weather option. They're breathable, moisture-wicking, and have an ultra
high waist that makes them perfect for pairing with a sports bra on a hot day.

 ** **Rave Review** : **“I never write reviews, but for these babies, I'll
make an exception. If you're looking for postpartum leggings, these are
awesome. I just had a baby a week ago, weigh 183 pounds at 5ft 7, and I feel
comfortable wearing form fitting tops with these. I ordered a large, and they
fit perfectly."

Average Rating| 4.2/5  
---|---  
Number Of Reviews| 28,694  
  
8

Best Compression Leggings For Warm Weather

## Under Armour HeatGear Armour High No-Slip Waistband Leggings

8

Best Compression Leggings For Warm Weather

## Under Armour HeatGear Armour High No-Slip Waistband Leggings

Now 20% Off

$40 at Amazon$50 at farmandfleet.com$50 at ems.com

These Under Armour leggings will stay put and never slip throughout the day.
The best part? The moisture-wicking fabric is made with their HeatGear tech,
which is designed to keep you cool in the hottest of temps.

****Rave Review** :** "I am really pleased with the fit, quality, and fabric
weight of these leggings. No issues with stretch, and they are not sheer at
all. They are also not overly heavy like thermal leggings. They seem to run
true to size, with generous amount of stretch. No looseness at the waist,
either."

Average Rating| 4.6/5  
---|---  
Number Of Reviews| 2,062  
  
9

Best Compression Leggings For Medical Support

## Bioflect Compression Micro-Massage Knit Leggings

9

Best Compression Leggings For Medical Support

## Bioflect Compression Micro-Massage Knit Leggings

$64 at Amazon

The bio ceramic material in these leggings are ideal for water retention and
painful swelling in the legs or arms. Reviewers like to wear these stylish
knit leggings after surgery or to relieve joint and muscle pain after giving
birth.

****Rave Review** : **"I bought these to treat my stage one lymphedema. I have
had them for two weeks and love them so far (I've worn them every day!). They
are very comfortable to sleep in, work out in, and wear out or to work in.
They provide great compression and effectively resolve my lymphedema."

Average Rating| 4.2/5  
---|---  
Number Of Reviews| 46  
  
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

10

Best Medium Compression Leggings

## Shapermint High-Waisted Sculpting Leggings

10

Best Medium Compression Leggings

## Shapermint High-Waisted Sculpting Leggings

Now 43% Off

$34 at Amazon

Shapermint's leggings have a serious following for how stretchy and
comfortable their materials are. They're designed for a high range of movement
and can be dressed up or dressed down depending on the day.

They won't offer the _highest_ compression on this list, but if you're looking
for a good in-between option that you can comfortably wear to yoga or just a
long day of travel, these make a great option.

 ** **Rave Review** :** "I love my high-waisted Shapermint legging! I went
back and bought more! They fit like a dream! They look amazing! And they stay
in place! I love them so much, I don’t want to take them off!"

Average Rating| 3.9/5  
---|---  
Number Of Reviews| 18,739  
  
Sabrina Talbert

Sabrina is an editorial assistant for Women’s Health. When she’s not writing,
you can find her running, training in mixed martial arts, or reading.
